SEARCH
Package server.Server.history

Class history

java.lang.Object
server.Server.history.history
public class history extends Object
Provides methods for managing chat history. It stores messages from all users in one text file, where each message is stored in format: "sender;receiver;date;time;message".

  • Method Details

    • init_Data

      public static void init_Data(String path_for_data)
      Initiates data.
      Parameters:
      path_for_data - path to said data

    • write_history

      public static void write_history(String user1, String user2, String msg) throws IOException
      Writes a chat message to the history file.
      Parameters:
      user1 - The username of the sender.
      user2 - The username of the recipient.
      msg - The message content.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when writing to the history file.

    • get_user_to_user_history

      public static void get_user_to_user_history(String your_username, String user2_username, DataOutputStream output) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Retrieves the chat history between two users and sends it to the client.
      Parameters:
      your_username - Your username.
      user2_username - The username of the other user.
      output - The output stream to send the history to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when reading the history file or sending data to the client.
      InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while waiting.

    • can_open_window

      public static boolean can_open_window(String your_username, String user2_username) throws FileNotFoundException
      Checks if there was sent request by one user and then it was accepted by other user.
      Parameters:
      your_username - Your username.
      user2_username - The username of the other user.
      Returns:
      True if there is chat history between the two users, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the history file is not found.

    • can_send_request

      public static boolean can_send_request(String your_username, String target_username, registrator req) throws IOException
      Checks if a request can be sent from the specified sender to the target user.
      Parameters:
      your_username - the username of the sender
      target_username - the username of the target user
      req - the registrator object
      Returns:
      true if the request can be sent, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the data file

    • can_accept_request

      public static boolean can_accept_request(String your_username, String target_username) throws IOException
      Checks if a request from the specified sender to the target user can be accepted. It checks if request to this user was sent from other user.
      Parameters:
      your_username - the username of the sender
      target_username - the username of the target user
      Returns:
      true if the request can be accepted, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the data file

    • correct_line_acc

      public static boolean correct_line_acc(String user1, String user2, String[] splitted_line)
      Checks if the specified line from the history file represents request sent from user1 to user2.
      Parameters:
      user1 - the username of one user involved in the request
      user2 - the username of the other user involved in the request
      splitted_line - line splitted by ";"
      Returns:
      true if the request can be accepted, false otherwise

    • correct_line

      public static boolean correct_line(String user1, String user2, String[] splitted_line)
      Checks if a line in the history contains message with "acc". This holds if and only if request for chatting was sent from one user and accepted by other.
      Parameters:
      user1 - The username of one user.
      user2 - The username of the other user.
      splitted_line - The split line of chat history.
      Returns:
      True if the line corresponds to a conversation between the two users, false otherwise.

    • correct_line_hist

      public static boolean correct_line_hist(String user1, String user2, String[] splitted_line)
      Checks if the specified line from the history file represents message sent from user1 to user2.
      Parameters:
      user1 - the username of one user involved in the conversation
      user2 - the username of the other user involved in the conversation
      splitted_line - the array containing the split components of the line
      Returns:
      true if the line represents a correct history entry, false otherwise

    • correct_line_req

      public static boolean correct_line_req(String user1, String user2, String[] splitted_line, registrator reg) throws IOException
      Checks if the specified line from the history file represents a correct request.
      Parameters:
      user1 - the username of one user involved in the request
      user2 - the username of the other user involved in the request
      splitted_line - the array containing the split components of the line
      reg - the registrator object
      Returns:
      true if the line represents a correct request, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the data file

    • get_msg

      public static String get_msg(String[] line)
      Extracts the message content from a line of chat history.
      Parameters:
      line - The split line of chat history.
      Returns:
      The message content.
